00041 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00042 
00043 #include "selftest.h"
00044 
00045 
00046 /*
00047  * Timers are implemented as a sorted queue of expiry times. The queue
00048  * is slotted, with each slot holding timers which expire in a
00049  * 2**STTIMER_MINPOLL (8) second period. The timers in each slot are
00050  * sorted by increasing expiry time. The number of slots is 2**7 (128),
00051  * to cover a time period of 1024 seconds into the future before wrapping.
00052  */
00053 #define STTIMER_MINPOLL        3   /* log2 min poll interval (8 s) */
00054 #define STTIMER_SLOTTIME       (1 << STTIMER_MINPOLL)
00055 #define STTIMER_SLOTTIMEMASK   (~(STTIMER_SLOTTIME - 1))
00056 #define STTIMER_NSLOTS         (1 << 7)
00057 #define STTIMER_SLOT(t)        (&stt_data.stt_hash[(((t) >> STTIMER_MINPOLL) & \
00058                                                     (STTIMER_NSLOTS - 1))])
00059 
00060 static struct st_timer_data {
00061         spinlock_t              stt_lock;
00062         /* start time of the slot processed previously */
00063         cfs_time_t              stt_prev_slot;
00064         struct list_head        stt_hash[STTIMER_NSLOTS];
00065         int                     stt_shuttingdown;
00066         wait_queue_head_t       stt_waitq;
00067         int                     stt_nthreads;
00068 } stt_data;
00069 
00070 void
00071 stt_add_timer(stt_timer_t *timer)
00072 {
00073         struct list_head *pos;
00074 
00075         spin_lock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00076 
00077         LASSERT(stt_data.stt_nthreads > 0);
00078         LASSERT(!stt_data.stt_shuttingdown);
00079         LASSERT(timer->stt_func != NULL);
00080         LASSERT(list_empty(&timer->stt_list));
00081         LASSERT(cfs_time_after(timer->stt_expires, cfs_time_current_sec()));
00082 
00083         /* a simple insertion sort */
00084         list_for_each_prev(pos, STTIMER_SLOT(timer->stt_expires)) {
00085                 stt_timer_t *old = list_entry(pos, stt_timer_t, stt_list);
00086 
00087                 if (cfs_time_aftereq(timer->stt_expires, old->stt_expires))
00088                         break;
00089         }
00090         list_add(&timer->stt_list, pos);
00091 
00092         spin_unlock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00093 }
00094 
00095 /*
00096  * The function returns whether it has deactivated a pending timer or not.
00097  * (ie. del_timer() of an inactive timer returns 0, del_timer() of an
00098  * active timer returns 1.)
00099  *
00100  * CAVEAT EMPTOR:
00101  * When 0 is returned, it is possible that timer->stt_func _is_ running on
00102  * another CPU.
00103  */
00104 int
00105 stt_del_timer(stt_timer_t *timer)
00106 {
00107         int ret = 0;
00108 
00109         spin_lock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00110 
00111         LASSERT(stt_data.stt_nthreads > 0);
00112         LASSERT(!stt_data.stt_shuttingdown);
00113 
00114         if (!list_empty(&timer->stt_list)) {
00115                 ret = 1;
00116                 list_del_init(&timer->stt_list);
00117         }
00118 
00119         spin_unlock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00120         return ret;
00121 }
00122 
00123 /* called with stt_data.stt_lock held */
00124 static int
00125 stt_expire_list(struct list_head *slot, cfs_time_t now)
00126 {
00127         int          expired = 0;
00128         stt_timer_t *timer;
00129 
00130         while (!list_empty(slot)) {
00131                 timer = list_entry(slot->next, stt_timer_t, stt_list);
00132 
00133                 if (cfs_time_after(timer->stt_expires, now))
00134                         break;
00135 
00136                 list_del_init(&timer->stt_list);
00137                 spin_unlock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00138 
00139                 expired++;
00140                 (*timer->stt_func) (timer->stt_data);
00141 
00142                 spin_lock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00143         }
00144 
00145         return expired;
00146 }
00147 
00148 static int
00149 stt_check_timers (cfs_time_t *last)
00150 {
00151         int        expired = 0;
00152         cfs_time_t now;
00153         cfs_time_t this_slot;
00154 
00155         now = cfs_time_current_sec();
00156         this_slot = now & STTIMER_SLOTTIMEMASK;
00157 
00158         spin_lock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00159 
00160         while (cfs_time_aftereq(this_slot, *last)) {
00161                 expired += stt_expire_list(STTIMER_SLOT(this_slot), now);
00162                 this_slot = cfs_time_sub(this_slot, STTIMER_SLOTTIME);
00163         }
00164 
00165         *last = now & STTIMER_SLOTTIMEMASK;
00166         spin_unlock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00167         return expired;
00168 }
00169 
00170 
00171 static int
00172 stt_timer_main (void *arg)
00173 {
00174         int rc = 0;
00175 
00176         cfs_block_allsigs();
00177 
00178         while (!stt_data.stt_shuttingdown) {
00179                 stt_check_timers(&stt_data.stt_prev_slot);
00180 
00181                 rc = wait_event_timeout(stt_data.stt_waitq,
00182                                         stt_data.stt_shuttingdown,
00183                                         cfs_time_seconds(STTIMER_SLOTTIME));
00184         }
00185 
00186         spin_lock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00187         stt_data.stt_nthreads--;
00188         spin_unlock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00189         return rc;
00190 }
00191 
00192 static int
00193 stt_start_timer_thread (void)
00194 {
00195         struct task_struct *task;
00196 
00197         LASSERT(!stt_data.stt_shuttingdown);
00198 
00199         task = kthread_run(stt_timer_main, NULL, "st_timer");
00200         if (IS_ERR(task))
00201                 return PTR_ERR(task);
00202 
00203         spin_lock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00204         stt_data.stt_nthreads++;
00205         spin_unlock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00206         return 0;
00207 }
00208 
00209 
00210 int
00211 stt_startup (void)
00212 {
00213         int rc = 0;
00214         int i;
00215 
00216         stt_data.stt_shuttingdown = 0;
00217         stt_data.stt_prev_slot = cfs_time_current_sec() & STTIMER_SLOTTIMEMASK;
00218 
00219         spin_lock_init(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00220         for (i = 0; i < STTIMER_NSLOTS; i++)
00221                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&stt_data.stt_hash[i]);
00222 
00223         stt_data.stt_nthreads = 0;
00224         init_waitqueue_head(&stt_data.stt_waitq);
00225         rc = stt_start_timer_thread();
00226         if (rc != 0)
00227                 CERROR ("Can't spawn timer thread: %d\n", rc);
00228 
00229         return rc;
00230 }
00231 
00232 void
00233 stt_shutdown(void)
00234 {
00235         int i;
00236 
00237         spin_lock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00238 
00239         for (i = 0; i < STTIMER_NSLOTS; i++)
00240                 LASSERT(list_empty(&stt_data.stt_hash[i]));
00241 
00242         stt_data.stt_shuttingdown = 1;
00243 
00244         wake_up(&stt_data.stt_waitq);
00245         lst_wait_until(stt_data.stt_nthreads == 0, stt_data.stt_lock,
00246                        "waiting for %d threads to terminate\n",
00247                        stt_data.stt_nthreads);
00248 
00249         spin_unlock(&stt_data.stt_lock);
00250 }
